snippet.title: A sequel to Super Size Me will go after fast-food chicken -- here's how McDonald's nuggets are made
snippet.content:
Morgan Spurlock, the filmmaker behind Super Size Me, is going after the fast-food industry again in a sequel to his hit 2004 documentary that skewered McDonald's. This time, he's focusing on the chicken industry.
The sequel, called Super Size Me 2: Holy Chicken!, is focused on how major fast-food chains develop, cook, and market chicken products. It will debut at the Toronto International Film Festival in September, .
We don't know yet what restaurants are going to be featured in the film, but given the filmmaker's history of hammering McDonald's, it's probably a safe bet that he'll pick on the Golden Arches again.
McDonald's has made an effort recently to be transparent about its food processes.
